column4: flash video has gotten really messed up on both Firefox and Chrome, staggering and/or speeding up both video and audio. it's really disturbing. Any tips on making the pain go away?
can you give the output of:   lsb_release -a; uname -a; dpkg -l | egrep 'flash|gnash|swf|spark'
sudo apt-get --purge remove flashplugin-installer   then enable the partner repo and install adobe-flashplugin
ah. Okay, I'll try it from the source then...
adobe flash is proprietary, there is no freely available source
bad phrasing. in this case, the souce is adobe.
the partner repo has what you need, it will install 64bit flash for your 64bit OS
yeah, I'm afraid that doesn't make a difference
it's even more messed up than FF. hm.
it has flash built in if you install the deb from the google site :)
I mean, it's mssed up on Chrome too.
I see, you weren't clear. Could download the 64bit flash plugin from the adobe site and put it into the browser's plugins folder
I assume you closed all browsers and reopened it after installing the flash plugin
wouldn't that be the same one as in the partner repository?
ah. loading up videos in totem, I have the same problem
